resources.string: Deployment Zones are more than 12″ away from the Central Line, and more than 6″ from the Short Battlefield Edges.

Player A’s Deployment Zone is more than 9″ away from the Cent- ral Line, and more than 12″ from the Short Battlefield Edges. Player B’s Deployment Zone is more than 15″ away from the Central Line. The Defender also chooses if they are player A or player B.

Deployment Zones are more than 15″ away from the Central Line. The table is divided along the Long Battlefield Edge into three equal areas (‘west’, ‘centre’, ‘east’). The Defender also chooses one of these thirds to be their ‘Spearhead Area’. The Attacker then immediately chooses one of the remaining two thirds as their Spearhead Area. units Deployed entirely within their Spearhead Area gain Vanguard (3″).

Each Deployment Zone alternates between 9″ and 15″ from the Central Line, as shown in the diagram. Along with selecting a side, the Defender selects one of the two De- ployment Zones. The Attacker has the other Deployment Zone.

Deployment Zones are more than 9″ away from the Central Line (see diagram), which is the line drawn from one corner of the Battlefield to the opposite corner. The Defender chooses which corners to use.

After choosing a side the Defender selects a Short Battlefield Edge; the Attacker has the opposite one. Defenders Deployment Zone is more than 6″ away from the Central Line, and 18″ away from the Attackers Short Battlefield Edge. Attackers Deployment Zone is instead more than 12″ away from the Central Line, and 18″ away from the Defenders Short Battlefield Edge.

Rules: whenever an Enemy unit Engaged in Combat,including all Attached Models, is removed as a casualty, put a single Trophy Token on a single Friendly Scoring unit that was just Engaged with the removed unit. A unit immediately loses all its Trophy Tokens if it loses Scoring. 

End of Game Completion: the player with the most Trophy Tokens on their units wins. 

If both players have no Tokens and one player also has no Scoring units, remaining on the Battlefield, the other player wins.
Setup during Pre-game Selections: mark the Battlefield Centre and divide the Battlefield into quarters.

Rules: END of Game Turns 3 to 6, a player gains a single Objective Counter if they have more quarters touching Friendly Scoring units than the opponent has. Each unit can only touch a single quarter at a time, determined by the location of its Centre. 
A unit with its Centre within 9″ of the Battlefield Centre does not count as being in Contact with any quarter. 

End of Game Completion: the player with the most Objective Counters wins.
Setup during Pre-game Selections: mark all Scoring units on the opponent’s Army List

Rules: none. 

End of Game Completion: combine the number of: 
1. marked Enemy units that were removed as a casualty whilst Engaged in Combat and 
2. Friendly Scoring units in Contact with the Enemy’s Deployment Zone.
Setup during Pre-game Selections: place two markers on opposite sides of the Battlefield, with their centres on the Central Line and 18″* from the Battlefield Centre.

Rules: END of Game Turns 3 to 6, a player gains a single Objective Counter if they control more markers than their opponent. A marker is controlled if there are any Friendly Scoring units and no Enemy Scoring units within 6″ of a marker. 

End of Game Completion: the player with the most Objective Counters wins. 

* For Battlefields of a larger or smaller size than the standard 72″×48″, replace 18″ with a distance equal to a quarter of the Long Battlefield Edge.
Setup during Pre-game Selections: mark the Battlefield Centre.

Rules: END of Game Turns 3 to 6, the player with the most Scoring units within 9″ of the Battlefield Centre gains a single Objective Counter. \n\nEnd of Game Completion: the player with the most Objective Counters wins.

Setup during Pre-game Selections: place a marker on the Battlefield Centre and two markers on opposite sides of the Battlefield, with their centres on the Central Line and 18″* from the Battlefield Centre. Then place a single Clue Token on each Terrain Feature except Impassable Terrain and playermade Terrain Features.

Rules: START of each Friendly Player Turn, pick up a Clue Token from each Terrain Feature where: 
• there is a Clue Token, 
• a Friendly Scoring unit is in Contact, and 
• no Enemy Scoring units are in Contact. 

END of Game Turn 3, the player with the most Clue Token selects which marker holds the Skull. In case of a tie, the marker at the Battlefield Centre is selected. 

End of Game Completion: the player with the most Scoring units within 6″ of the Skull wins. 

* For Battlefields of a larger or smaller size the standard 72″x 48″, replace 18″ with a distance equal to a quarter of the Long Battlefield Edge.

If an Army List does not contain enough units that fulfil the requirements of a Secondary Objective, the relevant player first selects all units that fulfil the criteria and can then choose any units for the remaining choices. \n\nDuring Pre-game Selections, Defender picks one of the following objectives, the Attacker then immediately picks one of the remaining two.
Pre-game Selections: on the opponent’s Army List mark TWO Rank-and-File units.
End of Game Completion: BOTH marked units are removed as a casualty, Decimated, or Shaken.
Pre-game Selections: on the opponent’s Army List mark TWO Scoring units.
End of Game Completion: at least one of the marked units is removed as a casualty, Decimated, or Shaken.
Setup during Pre-game Selections: on the opponent’s Army List mark the TWO most expensive
Non-Scoring Rank-and-File units or Characters of Height 4–5 with Solitary. End of Game Completion: at least one of the marked units is removed as a casualty, Decimated, or Shaken
Setup during Pre-game Selections: on the opponent’s Army List mark TWO Characters. These must be: Characters who can be Deployed during Battle Setup. (Note: you cannot mark Hidden Characters.)
End of Game Completion: at least one of the marked units is removed as a casualty, Decimated, or Shaken.
Setup during Pre-game Selections: on the opponent’s Army List mark ALL Scoring units and The Battle Standard Bearer. \n\nAt least 3 units must be marked.
End of Game Completion: Three or more of the marked units are removed as a casualty, Decimated, or Shaken.
Setup during Pre-game Selections: on YOUR Army List the opponent marks ALL Scoring units and The Battle Standard Bearer. \n\nAt least 3 units must be marked.
End of Game Completion: three or more of the marked units are NEITHER removed as a casualty, nor Decimated, nor Shaken.

Select all text
Select "SHARE"
Select "9th Age Quick Setup" from the applications list.

Select all text
Select "COPY"
